(irritated as always) Fuck that redneck noise, dude.  All dem chicks be  rappin' how dey losin' der' ho's and how dey ain't  got no bread for beer.  Fuck dat honky shit.  Got to  get me some motown jams, dig it?
(doesn't understand a word of it) Whaddaya talking shit for man.  Hey Junior!  Y'ever  smoke any shit?
Das right dude.  You be tryin' to string de black man  out on dat shit and keep him DOWN.  Time's be coming,  my man, when de black man's gonna throw off that  yoke.

(lonely in his way for company) Say I can dig it.  Smoke that shit everything kinda  gets weird y'know? (hiccups, sits) Y'hear that story the gooks is putting chemicals in  the grass so's we become 'pacifists' so's we don  fight (to no one in particular) Where the hell's everybody, they'se gettin high  that's what - bunch of hopheads, they think they  special ...
(turns away, bored) Don you worry Bunny, youse a killer anyway.
Yeah but I still like a piece of pussy once in a  while - ain't nothing like a piece of pussy cept  maybe the Indie 500.
Youse so fucked up man.
Y'ever look at yoself in the mirror Junior, youse  uglier than a dick on a dog man. (laughing)
Yeah, you had a piece of pussy on a plate in front of  you, you'd probably kill it.
Shit, I bet I been laid more'n you have.
Sure, you probably stick it in tween her knees and  think youse there.
Yeah?

Only way you'd get some pussy is your bitch dies and  wills it to you - and then maybe. Lt. WOLFE wanders down the aisle, beer in hand, slightly bypassing FU SHENG, the Hawaiin and TONY, a mustached hai browed Italian kid from Boston, who are playing some kind game.  They hardly acknowledge the Lieutenant who stops b RODRIGUEZ, the Mexican-American kid who is on his cot in neatly arranged area writing a letter home with a pencil, his words with his mouth, as always minding his own busin Religious objects comprise his few decorations.
(amiable) How you doing Rodriguez?
Good sir.
Need anything?

No sir. Wolfe winks at him, continues on to the POKER GAME going the center of the barracks, the main action.  BARNES,  Sgts.O'NEILL and WARREN, the quiet sullen black, SANDERSO SAL play as ACE, the tiny radio kid, and MOREHOUSE look o of them drinking beer and bourbon chasers from a bottle.
(to O'Neill) How's it going Red? (using his nickname)
Shit, cocksucker's got all the cards tonight.

(to Barnes) Looks like you're doing all right Sergeant. Barnes, raking in the chips, is the big winner, a light b sweat on his forehead and a somewhat glassy look to the e only indication he is drunk - his shirt peeled off reveal muscular, scarred body.
Yeah, and I ain't even cheating yet.
(the big blond kid) Have some Kentucky windage Lieutenant. (passes him the bottle of bourbon) Wolfe takes a nip.
Play Lieutenant?
Nah, I wouldn't want to get raped by you guys ...

What are you saving up to be Lieutenant - Jewish? Laughes.  Wolfe forces a smile, glad to move on.  There i continual worried rodent air about him, an anxiety, a des fill the vacuum in his leadership with a false masculinit
Catch you men later.  Enjoy yourselves. As he goes, O'Neill shakes his head after him.
Sorry ass motherfucker ain't he.  You think he gonna  make it Barnes? Barnes plays a card, glances, a minute movement of his he

Yeah that's what I figger.  Some dudes you jes' look  in their faces and you KNOW they just ain't gonna  make it. Barnes looks - with some irony - at O'Neill.  The Country tune has reached a crescendo whine which now mixes into:
Francis, the baby-faced black, and Manny, green shades co his skinny face, lead with a high blues falsetto.

(singing) 'People say I'm the life of the party cause I tell a  joke or two  Although I may be laughing loud and  hardy  Deep inside I'm blue ... The Hutch looks now like a Turkish bath with minimum visi the smoke fumes dense.  They are all up dancing on their King, Tubbs, Big Harold, Hoyt, Lerner, Crawford, Flash, D Elias - a few light gestures with their hands above shoul level, passing around the grass pipes while they shuffle, clicking.  The song - Smokey Robinson's "Tracks of My Tea accompanies them from a vintage tapedeck.

'... Since you've left me, if you've seen me with  another girl seeming like I'm having fun although she  may be cute she's just a substitute because you're  the permanent one ...' King and Big Harold wave Chris into the Circle and he sta swaying with them, feeling as if he's being accepted into family. Rhah watches it all, puffing away on his magic dragon pip shadows dancing on the walls. It looks like a Saturday night dance party.  A yearning f tenderness, for feminity, for a moment of peace in this n life.  Their eyes closed, thinking of dance partners that be here tonight.  Singing their souls out.
'... So take a good look at my face.  You'll see the  smile looks out of place.  Look a little bit closer.   It's easy to trace.  The tracks of my tears...'

An overwhelming 103 degree heat.  Chris is once more on p little better now but obviously struggling with a thick  unyielding bamboo thicket that forces him forward in a ca crouch.  Napalm jelly is hanging from the trees in great of spider webs, obliterating the sky.

New Year's Day, 1968.  Just another day.  Staying  alive.  There's been a lot of movement neat the  Cambodian border, regiments of NVA moving across.  A  lot of little firefights, ambushes, we drop a lot of  bombs, then we walk through the napalm like ghosts in  a landscape ... Chris working his way over twisted, broken stumps, branch the back of his flak jacket he's written, 'If I die bury upside down so the whole world can kiss my ass'.
Pssst! The signal for silence.  Chris freezes.  Barnes edging up
(whispers) Bunker ...

Where? Doesn't see it.  Following Barnes' imperceptible movement head. The bunker, dug into the ground and camouflaged with brus staring right at him, not more than 20 feet away.  Chris dead man if ... Barnes, checking the terrain, signals radioman Hoyt. Barnes edging up to the bunker, eyes everywhere.  Chris  following.  The tension builds.  They come up to the edge peer in.  Nothing. Barnes walks around it, slips in from back.  Chris covers other guys coming up now, making a small perimeter. Chris now starts to see things he didn't see.  Right in f his nose - there is a trench from this bunker to another another.  There is now in his view a complex of bunkers a thatched hootches and lean-tos all blending into the fore ghost city ... Elias and others fanning out now, careful ... whispered  conversations in the wind. Chris moves past a rope with freshly washed laundry stret between two trees, clothes stirring in the wind.  He look King points out a treehouse, then looks down as Lerner wh something and points - NVA rucksacks are laid out on the in an orderly platoon-sized pattern.
Elias goes down into a dangerous-looking TUNNEL, on a rop .45.  Barnes watching him.  We sense Elias loves the dang smiling.
Lt. Wolfe signals Manny and Chris out onto the two flanks
Rhah and King explore a treehouse.  Rice stores.  Rhah, a experienced soldier, seems tense, moves cautiously, expec booby traps.
Sgt. Warren cautiously explores another bunker, probing a tunnel in the bottom of it with a stick.  Bunny, having a frame, goes down into it, fearless.
Manny, the skinny black boy with the coloured beads, is o flank - alone, smoking a cigarette, humming.

On the other flank, Chris, also alone, waits, listening t sounds of the jungle.  He too is smoking a cigarette.  Th eeriness is everywhere.  Rays of morning light peeking th the cathedral dome of the jungle.  Bird calls.

Elias climbs deeper and deeper into the hole, a rope atta his waist leading out to the surface, his flashlight now around on a shaftway demarcating a TUNNEL that seems to s for at least 100 yards.  The light revealing cobwebs all it, but tall enough for a small man.

It's quiet, weird.  Chris takes his pants down, squats. thinks he hears something, tenses. There is a soft rustling sound now.  And as he focuses on realizes it is coming from very close to him.  Something and sinuous moving over the leaves.  He looks down. A bright yellow and orange-ringed krait viper is crawling between his two legs.  It stops, senses another life stan over it. Chris frozen with dread. The snake crawls on, pulling its long, long 15 foot body it. On Chris, eyes dilated, slowly regaining his breath looki around everywhere now.

Elias moving down the tunnel, fearless.  We expect someth moment to come out and nail him but nothing does.  He sto flashlight revealing a kitchen and an NVA hospital set up hammock swings as if someone just deserted it.  In anothe hammock is a dead man.  Elias advances cautiously.

Spec 4 Sanderson, the big handsome blond kid, is moving t an abandoned bunker.  With him is Sal, a tough street kid intense face, all whiskered.  Sanderson noticing now a me of 50-caliber ammo, U.S. marking, half-buried in the grou
Hey look at that. He opens the case.  Official-looking documents are inside glance through them, lighting cigarettes, the search over successful, they relax.
(a worried type) Leave it willya - it's gook shit.
Nah this stuff's important. He puts the documents back in the ammo case, lifts it.  I last thing he ever does.
The ensuing explosion shakes the ground, obliterating bot brances, smoke and dust flying out.
Out on flank, Chris hits the ground, hugs it.

Barnes runs up.  Black smoke sweeping through the trees. suddenly appears, stepping out of the smoke, stunned.  Th of his body is soaked in blood from a thousand shrapnel h his clothes shredded, he stares at Barnes, dazed.  Both h are gone and blood is geysering out like a water fountain crumbles - dead or dying.
Corpsman! He runs over to Sal, gets a hold of his face in a vicelik enraged, tries to yell some sense into him.
(directly to Sal) Goddamit!  Are you fucking kids ever gonna learn!   Don't you understand how easy it is to die! The Doc running up - one look tells us all we need to kno
Holy Jesus!
Lt. Wolfe, shaken, is on the radio with Cpt. Harris, word garbled through the air, trying to describe a primal horr
Barnes moving through the wreckage - sees severed limbs s in a sandbag.
Rhah crouches over a piece of leg tied into a hipbone and
Elias coming out of the tunnel, filthied.
Elias coming abreast of Wolfe.
Tell Six we need engineers here, this pos. is  crawling with traps.
They're on their way ... (consulting his map) There's a gook village half a klik downriver,  Battalion wants us to move in and search it ASAP,  something's going on ... where's Barnes?

Barnes is still there in the wrecked bunker, squatting th staring as if his mind has disconnected for a moment.  He up, touches his scars.  The look on his face suggests he deeply wronged by this tragedy, that he is taking it very personally.
Chris watches him from outside the bunker, awed. Barnes notices Chris watching him, takes a breath, stands

You gonna sit there and play with yourself Taylor or  you gonna be part of my war ... Awright, saddle up,  let's go - Tubbs you got point. The men moving into jungle formation, silently. Chris walking over into line, stops for a moment - notici freshly-severed eyeball partially buried in dirt, staring him.  He turns away, sickened.
Where's Manny?

Manny! ... Hey Buchanan. There is no answer.  The men in the platoon start to look other, sensing more trouble. Elias heads into the bush after him.  Barnes watches him Francis, his friend, and Tubbs and King follow.
Hey man whatcha doing ... where you at?  Get your  black ass back in here!
Out on the flank position, where he once stood, Elias wal looks.  The jungle is silent once again.  Francis, Tubbs, follow.  The others - Barnes, Lt.Wolfe, Warren, Chris, Rh

(whispering loudly) Manny? ... Manny? Their voices trailing off.  Bird cries come back. Elias combing the ground for clues ... nothing. Chris looking on, can't believe it, none of them can, a  collective chill running through the platoon.
The Platoon moving downslope in the Jungle, their faces g quiet, deadly.  King is on point.

We had to get to the village before dark so we left  Elias with some men to keep looking and to wait for  the engineers ... But it was King who found him ...  about 1000 yards downriver, not far from the village  - It was the end of the mystery. A moving shot approaching Manny.  He's trussed with rope, behind his back.  Throat cut, eyes startled open, mouth s a scream of terror. Barnes, the other men looking ... Chris.  Barnes says it everyone, 'The motherfuckers ...'

They come up out of the jungle onto the side of a CART TR where a tiny village overlooks the river.  The VILLAGE is series of thatched hutches made of C-ration cardboard and aluminum beer can sidings, faint whiffs of smoke coming f fires.  Pigs and dogs wander about. An OLD VILLAGER watches them pass from his tillable plot, a cigarette, one leg wrapped around his hoe, resting, no  expression.

... the village, which had stood for maybe a thousand  years, didn't know we were coming that day.  If they  had they would have run ... Barnes was at the eye of  our rage - and through him, our Captain Ahab - we  would set things right again.  That day we loved him  ... A pig loiters along the trail, rooting. Bunny coming up on it with a smile.
Hey pig, pig - come here, pig, pig. The pig grunts.  Bunny leveling his shotgun, fires point A horrible squeal. Chris, directly behind him, looks disgusted.
Tony suddenly points, excited, calls to Barnes.
There goes one! Their POV - a young VILLAGER fleeing down the slope. Barnes doesn't hesitate, nails him with a short volley of placed shots.
(to Tony) Check him out. He turns back into the village.
Troops fanning out over the village, some TWO DOZEN VILLA scattering to collect their children, dogs barking.
Get em out!  Get em out!
In another part of the village, Barnes hovers over a hole into some kind of tunnel.

Get out of there you fuckheads move!  Move! Fires a warning shot.  Three VILLAGERS climbing out of th hole, arms raised, but not showing any emotion.  Barnes t to his radioman Hoyt and Big Harold accompanying.

(to Harold) Put'em in the pig pen. (to Hoyt) There's more down there.  Gimme your Willy Pete. Hoyt, with reluctance in his eyes, hands over a specially grenade. Barnes stands over the hole, the grenade in hand. The three VILLAGERS who just came out of the hole, yell f distance, to others still in the tunnel, pleading with th come out.

Barnes throws the phosphorus in.  A muted EXPLOSION.  The sizzling acidic fumes.  Frying sounds.  A hideous scream somewhere deep in the hole. Hoyt, watching, is sickened.  Barnes businesslike. The Villagers, in grief, howl and tear at their faces.
(hustling up to Barnes) Sarge, we found some shit! Barnes going with him.
The sun is sittin there hot and high in the sky. Chris, strangling in heat, a demented look on his face, s into a hutch with Francis.

Threadbare, poor, a typical Buddhist shrine in the corner of light crisscross through the poor matting and c-ration Chris edges over, pries up a floorboard, flips it over, s There's a tunnel inside.  A long dark dangerous hole.
La Dai! La Dai! GET THE FUCK OUTTA THERE!
Hey take it easy man.  They're scared.
They're scared?  What about me!  I'm sick of this  shit man, I"m sick of this shit!  They don't want us  here!  Who do you think they're fighting for!  GET
Francis doesn't recognize him in his rage.  Bunny now com followed by O'Neill, drawn by the shouting.

Barnes stares down at a WEAPONS CACHE buried cleverly und the ruce urns.  Ace, Fu Sheng, Sgt.Warren, Lt.Wolfe, othe digging it out.  It's in white plastic wrappings - a load 47's, rockets, grenades, claymores, carbines, flares, NVA uniforms.  A real find.
(to Barnes) ... and over here there's enough rice to feed a whole  fuckin' regiment ... Barnes walking with him over to an undercover rice silo b out by Tubbs and Junior.  Barnes looks it over.
(to Warren) ... bring the honcho over here. (to Tubb and Junior) Burn it.

An Old Woman and her Son, a young man with one leg, throw their hands, climbing out of the hole with stupid confuse as Chris, shaking with his own sort of confusion and rage them, hustling them out.  The Young Man uses a pair of cr for his blown-off limb, hobbling like a mangy three-legge
Hey look at this! Ma and Pa Kettle here.  Look at  them - greasy gook motherfuckers!
Get up out of there! ... You see I didn't wanna hurt  you.  Why didn't you come out, when I said so hunh!  Why? WHY! WHY? DON'T YOU LISTEN ... WHAT ARE YOU

The couple, hands raised, muttering things in Vietnamese, understand a word, shaking their heads stupidly and smili impassive Oriental smile which sends Chris into a rage on can understand. His finger closes on the trigger of his 16. Francis, the baby-faced black, looks nervously, sensing t danger ...  Bunny amused, drawn in by Chris.  O'Neill wat passively from the lip of the hutch. The Young Man continues to grin, not seeming to realize t degree of danger he's in, which is what Chris wants - a t sign of acquiescence.  There is also the added element of off his manhood in front of an audience now.
Do 'em man, do 'em. Chris.  The trigger.  He pulls.  But he can't quite bring to kill.  The bullets exploding in the dirt at the edges young man's foot.
(demonic)

The Young Man hops up and down in a reflex fear of the so the bullets as they thud into the dirt.  Yet his eyes rem fixed on Chris in wonderment. Chris, firing out the magazine, seems to expend his blood He ceases, noticing - for the first time - the eyes of th Man.  They aren't stupid - nor fearful - but filled with  resignation and despair - a despair that Chris, in disgus himself, recognizes. Chris lowers the rifle, silent. The Young Man's impassive face shines now with tears.  Th young look - as if death itself would've been a release. turns his eyes away, an awkward sense of shame.
(leaves) Let's get out of here man. But Bunny takes up the slack, moves forward on the young
(to Chris) You chickenshit man, they're laughing at you, look at  them faces.  That's the way a gook laughs. The Young Man nodding affable to Bunny and mumbling ingra words in Vietnamese.

Yeah sure you are, you're real sorry ain't you.   You're just crying out your hearts about Sandy and  Sal and Manny - they're laughing at us!  Their family  is out there in the fucking bush blowing us away and  they're laughing at us!

(checking out the hutch) Forget it will ya, let's go ... Chris standing there, watching, sensing something awful i to come and unable to do anything about it.  It comes - s and without warning.  Bunny is looking at O'Neill, the Vi couple are muttering something.  In one fluid move, Bunny and with unbelievable savagery clubs the young one-legged the side of the head with the butt of his 16.
(stunned) Hey what are you doing!
Fucker! The young man is groaning on the floor of the hutch.  Bun smashes him - again and again.

That's for Sandy!  And this is for Sal!  And this is  for fucking Manny!  This is for me! Chris watches, horrified.  Never in his life has he seen  something so horrifying as this.  And yet he does nothing part of it.

(stepping back, examines what's left of the head, amazed) Wow!  You see his fucking head come apart?  Look at  that ... I never seen brains like dat before.  Jesus  fucking Christ ... The Old Lady is shrieking, hovering over the body of her Bunny studying her.

Betcha the old bitch runs the whole show.  Probably  helped cut Manny's throat.  Probably cut my balls off  if she could. (to Chris) Come on, man, let's do her. She cowers from him.  Chris steps back, horrified.  As is O'Neill, more puzzled than horrified.
(hitting her again) Let's zap all these motherfuckers!  Let's do the  whole village! He backs out of the hutch, scared.  Evidently Bunny is  temporarily insane.  But he spots O'Neill, yells at him.

head_text.subj: GET BACK HERE YOU FUCKING COWARD O'NEILL. THIS IS
FOR SANDY ... THIS IS FOR SANDY MAN

text: As he clubs her to death. On Chris' face, blood and brain tissue flying up into it.

A tiny knot of men are ringed around Barnes who is questi sturdy-looking man who is the VILLAGE CHIEF.  He has been stripped of his shirt, scars all over his body, scared. his ID papers out, trembling, showing them to Lerner who some pidgen Vietnamese.
Where'd he get these wounds? Lerner translates, the man talking back.
He says he was hit in a bombing raid.
He's a dink fosure.
Ask him what the weapons are doing here?
He says they had no choice.  The NVA killed the old  honcho when he said no.  He says the rice is theirs.

Bullshit ... who the hell was the dink we just nailed  on the riverbank? Chris and O'Neill come up, watch.  Others coming from dif places - sensing the narrowing drama.  But half the plato still at work in the village.  We hear shouts, grenade  explosions, occasionally gunfire.
... He says he doesn't know, NVA haven't been around  in a couple of months.  Maybe it was a scout or ... The men around Barnes grumble.
Yeah sure it was.  What about all that fucking rice  and the weapons ... who they for? (looking at the Village Chief) Cocksucker knows what I'm saying ... don't you Pop? (a blank look)

You're goddamn right he does! Lerner translating.  The Village Chief's WIFE is now on t scene, a middle-aged woman with angry features, yelling a trying to answer for her husband, a high-pitched barrage indignant words directed mostly at Barnes, and interspers the spitting of her betel nuts on the ground. The Village Chief trying to talk her down.  But things ar definitely getting out of control.  And the heat from the only aggravating the situation, pounding down on the acto the drama, their fatigues soaked in sweat and anger.
(finally) He swears he doesn't know anything!  He hates the NVA  but they come when they want and ...
He's lying through his teeth!
Waste the fucker, then see who talks.
What's the bitch saying?

(overwhelmed) She's going on, I don't know - why are we shooting  the pigs, they're farmers ... they got to make a  living, all that crap ... The Woman is still ranting when Barnes turns to her, quit casually levels his M-16, and puts a bullet in her head. goes down as if pole-axed. A stunned pause.  The Chief looking at his wife.  The Vil in background reacting. Wolfe looking ... Chris looking, shocked.  Doc, possibly straightest of them all, very uncomfortable.  They are al shocked insome way, but do nothing against the power of B Barnes walks over to the pig pen with the other Villagers casually, confronts them.
(to Lerner) Tell him he talks or I'm gonna waste more of 'em. Lerner shaken up, muttering to the Village Chief who is i kneeling next to the body of his wife, muttering in a hig of pain.
Go ahead, Lerner, ask him. A group of Villagers huddle to one side. Lerner, shaken, is yelling at all of them, demanding an a

They don't know Sarge, they don't know! (half believes it) Barnes turns his attention on the other villagers, his in apparent.  Everybody feels them.  They're next.  Barnes i unperturbed, very much in command of the situation, no ra emotions expressed. Chris has never seen such a thing in his life - but can't Can't stop it, just watches it like he's not quite there. The same goes for Lieutenant Wolfe, for all of them.  The outrageousness of Barns' killing seems to quell all prote
(sensing the impending massacre) Hey Sarge can we get in on this. Tony advances, the hairy Italian kid from Boston.

Let's go all the way, let's go for it!  Let's do the  whole fucking village.  Come on, Sarge. Chris' eyes ... Rodriguez next to him, is neutral but wil Francis is hesitant. Fu Sheng and Junior are ready to go for it.  Lt.Wolfe is  powerless, frozen. Sgt.Warren stepping up.  The massacre is just about to br The Villagers know it, kneel in prayer, mutter. Barnes suddenly grabs and drags a young 19 year-old Woman Village Chief's daughter, across the pen, throws her down knees, in front of the stunned Village Chief.  She's scre
This his daughter, right? Lerner nods.  Barnes pulls his .45, puts it alongside her

(to Village Chief) You lie ... You Vee Cee ... I caca ado Vee Cee! He chambers the .45, the Woman begging Barnes for her lif cradling his knees.  He sticks the gun down above her sku Chris wanting to cry out, to do something - but can't! A FIGURE suddenly flares out in the sun, advancing on the is Elias.

Barnes looks around.  They all look around. Elias walks right up to him, followed by his men - King, Crawford, others from the rear party.  He looks around. corpse of the Wife ... the Young Daughter sobbing.
(pissed) Stay out of this Elias.  This ain't your show.

head_text.subj: YOU AIN'T A FIRING SQUAD, YOU PIECE OF SHIT

text: The stock of his rifle swings up fast and hard smacking B full in the face, breaking two teeth. Barnes staggers back, hurt, bleeding.  Elias is on him li leopard.  Battering him with his fists. They struggle in the dust, two titans, their faces equall consumed with rage, clawing, spitting, punching, kicking, pounding each other's skulls in the dirt.  A dust storm s around them, the men closing around like excited apes at bloodfeast. Most of the men seem to be pulling for Barnes - Chris jus watching neutral.
But they rool on, smashing each other's faces in.  Both q fast, agile, mean fighters.  Sgts.O'Neill and Warren drag apart.
You're dead, you're fucking dead Elias!
YOU - you're going to fuckin' jail, buddy, you ain't  getting away with this one!!!!!
All right!  All right!  All right!!!  NOW BREAK IT  UP.  LET'S GO ... They compose themselves, the Villagers looking on, grievi their loss.
Alright, Six says torch this place!  Blow the weapons  in place.  Round up all suspected Vee Cees and shake  it up!  We ain't got much light left.
(to Wolfe) Why the fuck didn't you do something Lieutenant!
What are you talking about! (turns away, goes about his business)
(spins him around) You know what I'm talking about!

No I don't.  I don't know what the fuck you're  talking about, Elias! (goes) Who wants to be reminded?  A silence of shame.  The Men m away, Warren, Ace, Tony, Rodriguez, Barnes looking back o cold glare. The Village Chief is a broken-looking man, huddled over h wife's body. Elias stands there, frustrated. Chris glances at him, moves out.

A zippo cigarette lighter with the engraved initials: 'Fr lin to my Bunny Boy'.  It sparks a thick flare as Bunny l the dry straw on the roof of the Hutch where he killed th Woman and Young Boy. Their legs sticking out at the threshold.  The hooch burn fast, aided by the strong sun. Bunny watches with awe.
Sgt.Warren and Rodriguez lighting another hooch on fire.
Fu Sheng yelling 'FIRE IN THE HOLE!' throws white phospho the rice stores.
Barnes and Huffmeister, a big German kid from Texas, are the cord to blow the weapons cache.
Adams and Parker are poisoning the well with a white phos grenade: 'FIRE IN THE HOLE!'

Wolfe, Ace, Tubbs, Warren, Rogriguez rope the DOZEN SUSPE VILLAGERS together to take them back for questioning. Elias watches the Villagers mourn their losses.  In the  background, explosions, hooches popping with flames, the the violations of the Village winding down.
Chris wanders through this wreckage in the sun, like a da visitor from another planet, not believing it.  He sees  something, goes towards it - knows what it is.
Hidden at the edge of the woodline, King hands back a bow grass to Rhah, the chief head.  They're puffing away.
Whew! - where that come from?
Found it.  Growing in a garden.
(smokes) Sheeit, beats burning hutches anyway ... They meditatively look out at the Village - burning hutch sending up spirals of smoke.  Shouts.  Shots.  Chaos.
Yeah - stoned's the way to be ...

In a ditch running alongside the Village, partially conce foliage and anthills, Tony, Morehouse, and the ubiquitous have a 12-YEAR-OLD VIETNAMESE GIRL pinned to the ground, and squirming, naked.  They are fucking her to death.  Ju looks on, both curious and disgusted, but doesn't take pa

Take her up the ass ... As they roll her over, like excited dogs in heat. Chris, coming up, sees their heads dipping up and down on other side of the anthill, knows what they're doing.  He conscious decision to do something.  He runs over.
He strides right into them, shoves them off hard.  The gi tears.
What the fuck you want - she's a dink.

He seems disconnected, dazed by the sun, like he's talkin dogs - loud, repetitive words coming out of an anger he c barely control, trying to restore some sanity to a world totally nuts today.  Don't they understand?  Don'tthey ha sense of a mind?  Any kind of decency? The Men looking at him as if he's the one who's gone nuts them.  Bunny looking at Morehouse looking at Tony looking Junior.  The irony is lost on them, as Chris pushes throu help the poor girl put her scanty clothes back on.
(to the girl) It's okay ... it's okay ... Elias appears behind Bunny and the others, sees what's ha He signals them to move out.

Get outta here. The men grumble and slink off quietly.  Elias watching as Chris helps her to her feet, wounded in the intestines, s barely stand, blood saoking in her nether regions.  Chris her up as gently as he can and carries her.
(as if to himself) It's okay, it's okay ...

Near the pig pen, a DOZEN SUSPECTS are being led away on Tubbs, Warren, Rodriguez.  The others left behind look ba their village in ruins, homes burning, livestock dead or  scattered, belongings thrown and broken in the dirt.  BAB wail, the adults squat there on their heels watching with absolutely no trace of outward emotion. Past this Bosch-like canvas, Chris - carrying the girl - dazed by the horrors of this long afternoon.
The soldiers depart the village.  A huge EXPLOSION now ro earth and sends a spray of smoke into the blue sky as the cache explodes in stages that sound like the end of the w
The Company is digging into another overnight perimeter o ridge with a view of the Valley where the Village was.  C fires all around the perimeter.
At the Company,l Elias, Captain Harris, Barnes, Lt.Wolfe huddled.  Close on Harris, looking from face to face, ass judicial attitude.
... and you Lieutenant?
I didn't see anything sir.
I did.
That dink was reported to me as NVA sir by Sergeant  Barnes.  Sergeant Barnes. Squirreling out of any responsibility.
My report sir, will include Lt.Wolfe as being witness  to the shooting ...
All right, Elias.  Sergeant Barnes, I want a report  from you ...
You got it sir - and I can throw in plenty of eye- witnesses if you want sir ...

Not now.  We'll get into this when we get back to  base camp.  Right now I need every man in the field,  I want your guys to stick together ... Elias?   Barnes? ... You hear me?  This is no time for  fighting with each other. (pause, they nod) Tomorrow we're going back into that bunker complex -  from the East. (continuing) First Platoon will lead ... Brigade thinks they might  be back there tomorrow.  That's all ... Get some  rest. (turns away) Barnes, Elias eye each other and move off.
Wolfe walks alongside Barnes.
Don't worry about it Sergeant, he won't be able to  prove a thing, he's a troublemaker but ... Barnes is obviously worried, although he doesn't let on.

Elias' a waterwalker ... like them politicians in  Washington.  Want to fight their war with one hand  tied round their balls.  Ain't no time or need for a  courtroom out here ... Wolfe leaves him as Barnes turns into his foxhole where B O'Neill await him anxiously.
How'd it go. Banres shrugs.
Thataway Sarge, fuckin' Elias man, fuckin' squeal  that's what he is, gonna get everybody in the platoon  in shit.  Somebody oughta fix his ass ... Barnes fixing his coffee.
(worried) Gonna be an investigation or something Bob? Barnes says nothing, a cryptic look. O'Neill worried, Bunny, taking his cue from Barnes, slaps the back.
Ya worry too much O'Neill ...
Elsewhere on the perimeter, Chris is digging out a foxhol Rhah, as King and Lerner prepare the C's for dinner.
I know Barnes six months and I'll tell ya something -  that man is MEAN, red in his soul like a dick on a  dog.
Barnes gets killed, his jaws'd go on clacking ...
Where's he form?
Barnes comes from Hell.
Tennessee someplace.  Hill country.

Barnes took a bullet right there.  At Ia Drang Valley  ... (points to his forehead) And the cocksucker SURVIVED - that's BAAAD man.   That's his high, baby.  High on WAR! His eyes flare out dramamtically.  Chris, enthralled in s himself.
He done a year in Japan in the hospital, then when he  gets out, the first thing he done is re-up.  Four  years he been in the field ...
... and you know how many times he done been shot? (Chris shakes his head) Seven times! (with his fingers) Seven.
And he still wanted to come back?
Does a pee wee wanna take a wee wee?
The Good Lord works his revenge in strange ways.
Yeah, you done said it.  Revenge on US.
Does he have a metal plate in his head?
(smiles) You mean he's crazy?  No more crazy'n the rest of us  been out in the bush too long.
Well he ain't normal that's fosure.
That's what he is ... Baaaa! His hand flashes forward in front of Chris.  'HATE' is wr across the left hand knuckles in a sloppy, purplish-black Chris looking at it.

... and he's FILLED with it.  He's roaming these  jungles looking for little yellow devils to kill.   Remember the Devil does God's work too. (pause) ... and this here's Elias ... Baaaa! The other knuckle is out - 'LOVE' tattooed across it.  Rh smiles his crazy smil.  Chris stares fascinated at the tw knuckles side by side.  A moment on his face.
Love, yeah!
(makes a cuckoo sign) Here we go again with the crazy preacher stuff.  Rhah  seen too many movies.
Baaa, got no time to go to the movies.  Love and Hate  too busy fighting for possession of my soul.
Where's Elias come from?
(interjecting) 'Lias come naturally.
... don't know.  Done some time.  Heard he worked the  oil wells in Oklahoma, made some bread and washed up  in El Lay.
Yeah, get married to some crazy El Lay bitch, an  actress or somethin', she blew all his bread - LSD,  gurus, all that California shit, and then she turns  him into the cops on a drug rap.
Not the only man to meet his Jezebel either.
So he got a reduced and come over here.  Nam's his  freedom man, Nam's his pussy.  Three years he been  here.
Three years, Jesus, he's crazy as Barnes ...
Well sometimes a man jes don' wanna go back.  How you  gonna talk to civilians man?  People back in the  world just don't give a shit, y'know what I mean, to  them you're a fuckin' animal is all -

(to Chris) I was home on leave y'know and everybody's just  worried 'bout making money, everybody's out for  themselves, they don't even want to talk about it  man, it's like the fucking Twilight Zone back there -  you wouldn't even KNOW there's a war on here.  My  sister says to me why you have to go there like I  started this ...

Baaaa!  Fuck it, they sold us out - so what!  What'd  you'all expect?  Civilian life is phoney BULLSHIT  man.  They're ROBOTS man - watchin' dopey television  and drivin' dopey cars, and they fuck up, nobody  dies.  That's all right, you keep fuckin' up,  politicians keep lyin'.  Cause it don't really  matter.  Don't mean shit.  So what!  Whatcha want - a  parade!  Fuck that too!  No war time no grunt never  got no respect.  Till he was dead - and even THEN!   You're fighting for YOURSELF man!  You're fighting  for your SOUL, dat's all.  Remember dat.  And it's  some goddamn battle too - if you'se a man, wrestle  with that angel ... (swings his entrenching tool in a rhythmic chain-gang sty ... Love and Hate - the whole shitbang show, that's  the story then and now and it ain't hardly gonna  change ...
The stars are out in magnificent splendor.  A breeze rust through the trees.

Chris is turning in his sleep, perturbed, writhing.  The  whispering is more and more urgent.  Death is all around. shoots up out of his poncho liner as if shot, stunned.  S Looks around.  All is quiet.  Men sleeping. Elias is huddled in his poncho on guard next to his foxho Chris joins him, sitting, wiping the sleep from his eyes.
... I can't sleep, why don't you get some sack time.
... don't feel like it either.
... beautiful night.
Yeah.  I love this place at night.  The stars ...  there's no right or wrong in them, they're just  there.
That's a nice way of putting it. Elias cuffs a joint, keeping its glow hidden in the dark. pause, both of them meditative.
Barnes got it in for you, don't he?
(philosophically) Barnes believes in what he's doing.
And you, do you believe?
In '65 - yeah.  Now ... (pause) No.  What happened today's just the beginning.  We're  gonna lose this war ...
(surprised) You really think so ... us? Elias' eyes seem to go to some inner place, his passion s

... we been kicking other people's asses so long I  guess it's time we got our own kicked.  The only  decent thing I can see coming out of here are the  survivors - hundreds of thousands of guys like you  Taylor going back to every little town in the country  knowing something about what it's like to take a life  and what that can do to a person's soul - twist it  like Barnes and Bunny and make 'em sick inside and if  you got any brains you gonna fight it the rest of  your life cause it's cheap, killing is cheap, the  cheapest thing I know and when some drunk like  O'Neill starts glorifying it, you're gonna puke all  over him and when the politicians start selling you a  used war all over again, you and your generation  gonna say go fuck yourself 'cause you know, you've  seen it, and when you know it, deep down there ... He plants his fist in Chris' gut, expelling his breath su the force of the blow - like a power passed between them.

... you know it till you die ... that's why the  survivors remember.  'Cause the dead don't let em  forget. His eyes blazing, reliving the deaths in the village, lic wounds for the platoon, mourning the failure of its heroi Chris looking at him, a little awed by his intensity.  El looks away, embarrassed that he has sermonized, looks bac stars.
Oh shit!  Sometimes there's things in my head ...  man.  Grass does that to me, fucks me all up like a  crazy Indian ...
Do you believe that stuff about ... knowing you're  gonna die?

Yeah, those are the guys that live.  I really don't  think Death gives a shit, it's like a giant garbage  can, I think it takes whatever it can get ... you  never know where it's gonna come from anyway ... so  why spin your wheels? He shrugs, a certain bravado masking his own uncertainty.

... You ever think about reincarnation, all that  stuff? A lightning quick movement follows.  Elias' hand passing face like a mime, a click of the fingers and he leans clo Chris.  A new expression on his face.  Devil's eyes, mock child, danger in his soul, excitement, sex - the Elias th saw in the smoking session in base camp.  Chris smiles, s in, almost laughs and then the face is gone again.

Sure, goes on all the time.  Maybe a piece of me's in  you now, who knows.  But when you die - really die -  that's a big return ticket. (soft) I like to think I'm gonna come back as ... as wind or  fire - or a deer (likes the image) ... yeah, a deer ... He smiles at the thought.  Chris looks at him, looks away shooting star falls suddenly and dryly through the cosmos eyes.

The Platoon moves along a shallow STREAM bordering the ju thick RAIN falls amid cracks of distant thunder.  Chris, Francis, Big Harold, others are at the rear of the platoo ponchos pulled over them like big sad grey tents.  There' holdup ahead and the Men rest on rocks or stand.  The rai a pointilistic pattern, the men collages of grey, their r slung upside down to keep dry. Barnes is up ahead, out of the stream bank, on the radio.

Lerner's on point, resting in the shadow of a decaying ol Catholic Church from the 19th Century.  The jungle has lo won the battle, vines creeping into the cracks, remnants arches layered around the church at the epicenter.  Behin is Sgt.Warren and his radioman.
Elias, further back, is checking out the jungle alongside clearing, noticing a number of old spider holes long sinc abandoned.  He goes over and checks them.

Back at the stream, Rhah, looking old and whiskered under poncho hood, lights up a roach, puffs it.  Another crack thunder.  Chris comes over, sits with him on his rock.  R passes him the joint.  He smokes. Big Harold pulls a leech out of his open crotch area.
Shit, lookit this little fucker trying to get up ma  glory hole.
Hey Big Harold, put dat in your turkey loaf it won't  come out your back end.
(ribbing) Yeah, big boy, thought you had that laundry gig all  laid out?
(pissed) Shit, got to paint myself white get one of dem jobs.   Get ma request in for a circumcision.
Gonna be a rabbi man?
Gonna cut your pecker down to size hunh Big Harold?
Dat's okay wid me, better to have a small one den no  one at all.
Your girlfriends gonna look for new lovers, man.   Best thing a bro's got's his flap.
I'll drink to your flap in Chicago, King.  All I  gotta do is stretch it out to 15 days and I'll be  short 15 and the Beast just wouldn't dare send me  back to the bush.
You gonna get some for me back in the World, Harold?   Whatcha gonna do? (dreaming of it)

The world's gonna be ma oyster man.  First's I gonna  EAT - all the hamburger and french fries and steaks  soaked in onions and ketchup I can get.  Then I'se  gonna FUCK and SUCK Sandy Bell till I sore all over  and can't fuck no more, and den I'se gonna SLEEP for  DAYS, for WEEKS!  Den I'se gonna think bout what  comes next ... The words carry over Chris staring out at the rain, feeli leaden fatigued high.  Passes the roach, down to a millim back to Rhah who points to his face.
... you got one right there. Chris feels for, finds the leech on the edge of his lip, under his breath.
(in the stream, on radio) All right move out. The men start slogging on against the rain. Junior is drinking from the stream, as Fu Sheng passes.
Don't drink that asshole.  You're gonna get malaria.
Shit I hope so!
On point, Lerner moves out through a remnant of an old ar somewhat casual in his approach to point.
Hey Sarge, you wanna tell me which way or do I get to  figger it out? Sgt.Warren, picking up a quick azimuth on his lensatic co points.  Lerner moves in the new direction.
Lerner moves away from the clearing, working up a slight when the MACHINE GUN FIRE erupts out of the jungle, spinn - throwing him into the dirt like discarded garbage. The men are down, yelling.

Ambush!  Incoming!  Fucking incoming! Suddenly an RPG rocket breaks out of the bush, sounding l atom bomb as it devastates the front of the Platoon.  Rad is continuous now, back and forth between the three plato radios, through the ambush.
DOC, UP HERE!  Lerner's hit! ... More machine gun fire.
DOC!  Over here - we got ... one ... two down.   Warren's hit.
Chris moving up with Rhah and the others out of the strea hit the ground next to Sgt.O'Neill, who looks pretty scar obviously not about to move.
What's going on?
Shit they got RPG's on our ass.  Fucking ambush -  they was waiting for us to break trail!
Another rocket whistling in.  A huge roar.  Trees shredde dust rising.
Who's on point?
Lerner and Warren. Chris uses his M-16 to lever himself up into a crouch and suddenly dashes forward, passing Rhah.

Where you goin' man! Chris tearing up.  Past Flash - the hip black head with t colored beads.  He's dead, torn and shredded, his face an stuff with dirt.  Next to him Doc is frantically tourniqu Tubbs, shot in the legs.  He's screaming. Chris keeps moving to the front as if compelled.
Barnes is laying out fire.

Goddamit, you assholes get fucking' firepower out  there! (to Hoyt on radio) Get Two Bravo up here.  Get me a gun. (to others) Spread it out!  More to the flanks!  Look for a  fuckin' target! Another explosion.
Chris comes alongside Francis near the point, throws hims down.  Banging his head against his helmet as he falls. incoming rounds are tearing up the front of the platoon.
(to Francis) Where's Lerner?
(terrified) Out there man - behind the log. Looking.  A body - moaning, sort of moving, wriggling, as trying to escape the pain.

Oh Jesus! His eyes moving to Sgt.Warren lying alongside a tree - ca trying to stack his intestines back into his ruptured sto Another RPG comes in. Chris makes a conscious decision, moves up - bit by bit,  shielding himself with tree stumps, ant hills, laying out trying to get closer to Lerner. Francis following his progress, bug-eyed. Fu Sheng now comes up with his M-60 - Harold his loader, ammo flapping against their bodies.  He fires from the hi providing cover fire for Chris, then pops down.
Chris, firing out another magazine, crawls closer to Lern trying to ascertain if he's still alive.

Lerner!  Lerner, can you hear me man? Lerner groans.  A fresh burst of AK fire rakes the area. jerks spasmodically with the impact of the rounds. Chris spots the sniper.  In a hole in the ground.  Twenty meters off.  Snapping the magazine out of his AK to reloa live gook. Chris tears off a volley at him but the gook disappears i hole.  This is the moement, Chris realizes it, it's now o if Chris intends to get the gook.  He's got to make a mov the man has reloaded his weapon. He pulls his grenade, pops the pin.  He lets the spoon fl activating the grenade-timer, as he humps to his feet and for the gook hole, concentrating, concentrating.  That he going to pop up any second with a freshly-loaded weapon a his head off. Chris won't make it back to the hole.  The throw has to b perfect.  He won't get another chance.  He heaves the fra and rolls away.  The throw is perfect, the golden arc of from the outfield nailing the baserunner.  It twists clea the hole.  The explosion muffled but deadly. Chris scrambles to his feet, a look of almost total surpr his face.  He can't seem to believe he did it.  Pointing before him, he advances on the hole, looking over the muz see the badly-mangled NVA man twisted at the bottom. Chris hurries over to Lerner.  He's in bad shape, hit in places, vaguely conscious.

Gator!  Gator! (Lerner groans) I'm gonna get you out man.  You're gonna be okay  Gator ... okay? Fu Sheng laying out fire to protect them, Harold splittin get more ammo. Chris getting Lerner to his feet, hauling him back with a strength, past Francis ...
Lt.Wolfe seems disorientated, struggling with the rain wa washing off his map, trying to read the coordinates for a fire mission.

(into the radio) Redleg, Redleg ... Ripper Bravo Two Actual.  Fire  mission.  Grid six-four-niner ... four-zero-two.   Direction six-one-zero-zero.  Dinks dug in bunkers.   Danger close.  Adjust fire, over ...
Rog, Two Bravo.  Solid copy, stand by for shot, out.
Sir, Bravo Three is inbound from the Sierra Whiskey.   Should be here in two zero mikes if'n they don' hit  any shit.
Fuckin' A! Elias runs up to him.  Fire all around, incoming and outg makes them yell to each other.

Lootenant, they're kickin our ass, they know we're  gonna bring heavy shit on 'em pretty soon so they're  gonna get in tight under the arty.  I spotted a cut  running around to the left.  Lemme take some men and  roll up that flank .. (pointing) I can work right up on 'em ... Wolfe unsure, looks up for the artillery.
(to Ace) Get me Barnes ... I don't know 'Lias, we got four  down up there, if I split you off, we ... Elias grabs a stick, urgent, starts drawing their positio dirt for Wolfe.
Look, Lootenant ... Wolfe looks up, relieved as Barnes splashes into the CP g Thunder peals.

(yelling at Wolfe and Ace) Where the fuck is red platoon!  Tell 'em to get their  asses up here!  What the fuck you doin' back here  Elias?  Round up your assholes and move 'em up front,  we're getting chopped to shit.

(yelling back) Barnes, listen to me ... there's 5-6 spiderholes back  there (points) next to the church. (draws it into the ground as he talks) Third Platoon's coming up the stream to reinforce us.   Flank's wide open, dinks get 3-4 snipers in these  holes, when Third Platoon comes up, they'll get us in  a crossfire with 'em.  We'll shoot each other to  shit, then they'll hit us with everything they got.   It'll be a massacre! Barnes looking at the drawing.
Sounds pretty far out to me 'Lias.
Maybe but I seen it happen at Ia Drang in '66, First  Cavalry and they cut us to fuckin' pieces! (back to Barnes) Give me three men, if I'm wrong, I can still roll up  that flank.
(a look) Take off, but keep your radio here. Elias goes, stops, looks at Barnes ...
... You keep pouring out that suppressing fire,  Barnes.  I don't wanna be caught out there with my  ass hanging out you hear me?

Don't tell me how to fight this fucking war, 'Lias,  you go crying to fucking brigade on your time.  Out  here you belong to me.  Now move. A look.  Elias goes fast.  More thunder peals.  As the 15 howitzers - sounding like deep tom-toms some three miles - beat out their shells.  An ominous sound.  Closer.
Sir!  Shot out.  Arty's on the way!
(hurrying back to the front) Get that asshole O'Neill up here willya!

Fu Sheng is laying out fire when he senses something, loo The artillery shell sounds too close.  Getting bigger and on the horizon.  Too big, too loud.  A groan of fear on h then knowledge.  Then ... a huge EXPLOSION engulfs him.
Short round!  It's short, man!  They fuckin' got Fu  Sheng!  BARNES! OVER HERE!
Barnes hearing it, starts forward.  Another huge shell st to whistle in on them.

That fuckin' idiot! It explodes.  This is about three times the intensity of The jungle floor shakes, trees splinter.  Barnes is knock his knees, rimaces in pain.  Hoyt, Barnes' radio operator screams out as a fist-sized chunk of hot shrapnel sticks back.  He's screeching, frantically trying to shuck the r from his back, his fatigue shirt smoking. Barnes jerks the radio off Hoyt's back, knocks the man to knees and unsheathes his bayonet.  Ripping off the back o shirt, Barnes sets to digging out the shrapnel.
Morehouse is decimated by a third explosion, chunks of sh whirring like battleaxes into the tree trunks.

Big Harold is tearing blindly away from the front, helmet rifle dragging in the mud when he stumbles, sprawling fac He jumps up, looks back, sees now the wire over which he It takes a second to register.  He shares a look with Bun already on the ground.
Satchel charge!  GET DOWN! Harold goes for the ground the same instant the satchel e
Chris, further back, dumps Lerner with Doc who's got more can handle.
Take care of him Doc!  Please! Doc looking at him, a dark look of hopelessness.  Lerner mess, groaning, reaching for Chris' hand.
... don't ... don't leave me man ... A look between them.  Rhah instersecting.
Taylor - get your ass over here.  Move!

Hang tough, Gator.  Hang in there, man, you're gonna  be OK ... just hang on. Feeling like a liar, peeling the man's hands off him, lea there looking numb.  Chris is shaken, Lerner's blood all him. He tears out after Rhah, linking up with Elias and Crawfo Elias motioning them to hurry.  Another huge artillery ro exploding out to the front.
Sgt.O'Neill, scared out of his mind, hugging the earth, t crawl into a small cut in the ground but finds it occupie cringing Junior.
Barnes rushes up out of the forest like Achilles, towerin rage, at Lieutenant Wolfe, ripping his handset from him a Lieutenant reads off the coordinates off his map.

YOU IGNORANT ASSHOLE! - What the fuck coordinates you  giving!  You killed a bunch of people with that  fucked up fire mission!  You know that? ... ah shit! Wolfe stares at him, open-mouthed.  Disgusted, Barnes hun down to read the coordinates from his own map into the ha

Redleg Romeo .. Ripper Bravo Two.  Check your fire,  check fire, you're short on our pos!  I say again,  check your fuckin' fire! ... From Registration point,  add one five zero, left five zero, fire for effect! New incoming fire drowns out Barnes.
Elias - a defiant look on his face - moves fast but cauti back across the Church landmarks.  Chris following then R Crawford.  The RAIN has now settled into a mist hugging t ground.

Move it!  Move it! Elias comes to a stop, looks.  Behind them we hear the so battle, gauging their distance from the main body. The spider holes are still empty.  But he listens, senses something out there getting closer.
They're coming ... Chris looking at Rhah.  How does he know? Elias points out an imaginary line across the breaking mi
Stagger yourselves across this line, shoot anything  that moves.  They'll be coming from here.
(team leader) Gotcha.
One of them gets through it's curtains.
Where you going?
Down along the river 'bout 100 metres, 'case they try  to flank us there.  Third Platoon's coming up on our  rear so watch for 'em.
I'll go with you.
No ... I move faster alone. (a grin) Elias, his pack stripped, is gone, like a fleet leaf, van into the Jungle.
(stringing them out) Okay Crawford - over here.  Taylor - down twenty  yards behind that tree.
Barnes has finished correcting the fire mission, hurls th handset back at Wolfe, a wild look in his eyes, studying incoming fire.  Makes a decision.

Let's move back, link up with Three.  Let the arty do  a little work. (to Ace on radio, ignoring Wolfe) Push Two Alpha and Two Charlie.  Tell'em to haul ass  and re-group at the church.  Tell'em NOT to fire. (Ace transmits)
What about Elias?  We pull back they'll be cut off.   He needs cover fire.

(looks at him like he's stupid) I'll get him. (with a threatening undertone) You just haul ass too lootenant. (going, to Ace) ... don't send Bravo Three up till I get back to the  CP.  Now move out, all of you. As he snaps his weapon onto full auto and runs off after a crouch ... a man with a mission.

Next to the Church deployed in the jungle, Rhah looks on, Chris in his position, waits.  It is so silent in compari the racket from the battle across the forest.  The Mist c the trees, moist and lovely.  Then, a flicker of movement Chris hears it, tightens.  His POV - at fifty yards.  An  evanescence of beige and green uniforms moving towards hi fast, scurrying.  They look like headless ghosts. Chris opens fire.

Rhah and Crawford open up.  A rachet of sound, one of the seems to go down, then another but at this distance throu jungle it is difficult to say.  The firing just as sudden breaks off and the silence returns.
(ecstatic) Yeah!  I got two of them fuckers ...
I got one ...

... See them go down?  Like fuckin' target practice  man, fuck you Charlie!!  Ho Chi Minh sucks dead dick!  ... Crawford! (sees him, stunned) Crawford, the blond-locked California beach boy, lies on earth, hit in a lung, having difficulty breathing, moanin soft undercurrent.  Chris runs up on him.
Oh man!  ... man! Attending him.  Rhah runs up.
Looks like a lung babe.  But you're gonna be all  right, you only need one of them fuckers.
Oh shit man I never thought I'd get hit, I was ... (gagging)
Stay cool.  We gonna carry you out. Barnes appears, running towards them, looking down at Cra at Rhah.
Sarge, 'bout five gooks tried to ...
Where's Elias?
... came through right over there.  We got three of  them, we ...
Didn't you hear the arty shift?  We're pulling back.   Get your wounded man and get the fuck back to the  church.  Get going.
(indicating jungle) ... but 'Lias is still out there.

I'll get him.  You get the man in, Taylor (indicating Crawford) NOW.  Or I'll Article 15 both your asses.  Move! Chris and Rhah look at Barnes sullenly, then reluctantly moving Crawford onto a poncho liner they use as a litter.
Move it, MOVE IT! He's in his blackest rage, the force of his words almost  physically pushing the men to move out with Crawford.  Ba turns now to deal with Elias.

Elsewhere, Elias stands silently, listens to the forest. distance the firefight can hardly be heard.  His helmet g hair hanging free, he is at his best now - alone.  He hea Somebody running through the jungle, about 100 yards, boo leaves, coming towards him. He begins to move lateral to the sound.  His steps unhear better at this than the enemy. THREE ENEMY FIGURES now appear, crouched and moving very with light equipment through the mist. Elias swerves up in immediate foreground, his back to us, All three Figures fall. A quick glimpse of Elias, not bothering to stop, moving t next position.
Barnes, moving through the jungle, reacts to the fire, re his course.  Like a hunter stalking a deer.  Suddenly the more firing.  Then silence -

TWO MORE ENEMY lie dead in the jungle.  A rustle of movem then a CRY - chilling, jubilant, a war cry. A pair of feet moving lightly over the jungle.  A glimpse Elias.  In his full glory.  Roaming the jungle, born to i
Barnes fixing on him, moving.

An NVA SOLDIER, jungle-whiskered, dirty, smart, crouches, listens, looks to his PARTNER.  What are they fighting he First One mutter something sharp and they split fast in t direction they've come. They get about six steps when Elias suddenly rises up fro bush, not ten yards in front of them, his shots ripping i them, driving the surprised life from them.  Elias is gon
Elsewhere, another three NVA stop, turn and flee back fro they came.
Chris and Rhah get Crawford back to the church grounds, l down.  No activity around them.  Chris plunges back into jungle where they left Barnes.
Taylor!

Barnes moving, stops, listens.  Something is running towa But it's hidden by the bush.  He brings his rifle up smoo quick, waits, then as the bush parts, Elias is standing t Looking at Barnes. Barnes sees him, starts to lower his rifle, but then stop raises it back an inch, sights it.  Pause.  A cold searin of hatred coming over his face. In that moment, Elias understands.  Quick as a deer, he m move, trying to plunge back into the bush. Barnes fires.  Once, twice, three times - the blast rocki jungle. Elias jerking backwards into the bush, mortally wounded. cries.  A crime against nature. Barnes calmly lowers his rifle, and walks away from it.

Chris, cutting through the jungle, hears the shots.  He s listens.  Someone is moving through bush towards him, lea foliage shaking. Chris tightens, raises his rifle. Barnes steps through into his sight - sees him. Chris lowers his rifle.  Barnes walking past him as if he even there.
Elias is dead.  Join up with the platoon.  Move it.
(shocked) He's dead!  Where?  ... You saw him?
Yeah.  Back about 100 metres.  He's dead, now get  going, the gooks are all over the fuckin' place. Moving on quickly.  Chris has no choice but to follow, lo back one more time.

TWO CHOPPERS are coming into a LZ in front of the Church. two platoons, Second and Third, reinforcing, are being ev as quickly as possible, one load (6-8 men, depending on t wounded) after other.  The choppers are spraying dust all the place.  A scene of chaos, radio talk layering it.  Do of supplies, making do with improvised bandages, etc.

head_text.subj: MOVE IT MOVE IT MOVE IT.

text: Lerner goes by, horribly wounded on a makeshift litter, i chopper, Doc attending, holding the IV. Chris catching a glimpse of him, waiting to get on the ch turning to look as: Hoyt and Sgt.Warren, both wounded, are hurried aboard on The chopper lifting off. Chris and others now running to the corpses of Flash, Mor and Fu Sheng lying under dirty ponchos, their boots stick The ponchos are blown away in a burst of wind off the cho blades, revealing their faces - dirt stuffing their eyes mouths, waxen figures. Chris and the others lifting them and carrying them towar next chopper now coming in. They throw the bodies on.  Tubbs and Crawford, both wound move past Chris, into the chopper.  Chris running back, w carrying a litter - their eyes falling on: Barnes talking with Wolfe and Ace, making signals under t roaring sounds of the chopper.  Shaking his head.  No.  N Chris and King looking at each other, mute.  They numbly loading Big Harold, minus his leg, onto the stretcher. The Third Chopper is down now, waiting, roaring blades  silhouetting off the face of the cathedral.  A ROCKET BLA suddenly goes off not too far from the chopper, incoming The DOOR GUNNER signaling for them to hurry, laying out f

Chris and King hustling Big Harold's 250 pounds into the Climbing in with him.  Wolfe, Barnes, Ace running in with The perimeter is bare. Chris' eyes flitting over Barnes as he jumps in.  The cho lifting off as another explosion rocks the area.  The Doo sees something, opens up. Big Harold, cursing, looks chalky but hog happy as he man glance down at the jungle.  His right leg is gone.  Tears rolling out of his eyes.
Man, you gonna be in Japan this time tomorrow, Big  Harold.

Yeah, I'se lucky dis time, what's a leg to get the  fuck outta here ... (at the NVA) Eat ma shit, you motherfuckers! He sinks back, sick.  Chris' eyes sudenly fix on somethin can't believe it.  He shoves King, points.  King sees it. stunned. Barnes is looking.  So's Lt.Wolfe, so's Ace.  So's the Do Gunner. Elias is coming out of the jungle.  Staggering, blood dis his face and chest, hanging on with all his dimming stren looking up at them - trying to reach them. Chris shakes Wolfe, his words drowned out by the roar. The Chopper Captain looking down, dips.  His co-pilot poi The NVA are coming out of the jungle, closing on the spot Elias is. Incoming rounds are hitting the chopper.  The Door Gunner maniacally firing. Barnes looking down at the man, can't believe it. Elias is on his last legs now, obviously being hit by the incoming fire of the NVA.  He falls to his knees, still  stretching upwards for life. The Chopper Captain shakes his head at Wolfe. The Chopper dips one more time firing at the NVA, low and over the jungle. Chris looking back in horror. Elias crucified.  The NVA coming out now by the dozens fr treeline. Elias crumbling to the ground.  Obviously dead or dying.

... we still got one on the deck.  Bring the gunships  in. Barnes drawing in. Chris looking at him in revulsion.  He knows.  Barnes see look, ignores it, all of them sitting there silent, livin that final horrifying image of Elias.
The 'heads' are assembled - what's left of them.  Rhah, K Francis, Doc, Adam, a quiet black kid, and Chris, who is  impassioned tonight.
He killed him.  I know he did.  I saw his eyes when  he came back in ...
(puffing on his bowl) How do you know the dinks didn't get him.  You got no  proof man.
Proof's in the eyes.  When you know you know.  You  were there Rhah - I know what you were thinking.  I  say we frag the fucker.  Tonight. He looks to King who puffs on a joint, his eyes red.
I go with dat, an eye for an eye man.
Right on, nothing wrong with Barnes another shot in  the head wouldn't cure.
(to Chris) Shit boy you been out in the sun too long.  You try  that, he'll stick it right back up your ass with a  candle on it.
Then what do you suggest big shot?
(to Chris) I suggest you watch your own asses cause Barnes gonna  be down on ALL OF 'EM.
How you figger that?
Shit man - Human nature. Flashes the old knuckle - 'HATE'.
Then you jes gonna forget 'bout Elias and all the  good times we done had?  Right in here.
He dugged his own grave.
(correcting) He dug it.
He DUGGED it too.
Fuck this shit!

You guys trying to cure the headache by cutting off  the head.  'Lias didn't ask you to fight his battles  and if there's a Heaven - and god, I hope so - I know  he's sitting up there drunk as a fuckin' monkey and  smokin' shit cause HIS PAINS HE DONE LEFT DOWN HERE.   Baaaaaaaaa! (a vehement movement of his head)
You're wrong man!  Any way you cut it Rhah, Barnes is  a murderer.
Right on.
I remember first time you came in here Taylor you  telling me how much you admired that bastard.
I was wrong.

(snorts) Wrong?  You ain't EVER been right - 'bout nothing.   And dig this you assholes and dig it good!  Barnes  been shot 7 times and he ain't dead, that tell you  something?  Barnes ain't meant to die.  Only thing  can get Barnes ... is Barnes! Barnes stands there, silhouetted in the trap door, lookin at the men who are stunned to see him here. He steps down into the hutch, his face now lit by candle A bottle of whiskey in his hand, drunk, ugly, sweating, b always, with dignity, possessive of his silence.  He feel fear in the silence, enjoys it.
(soft) Talking 'bout killing? He totters slightly as he circles the outer edge of the h No one talks.
Y'all experts?  Y'all know about killing? He takes the bowl from Adams, smokes it.
You pussies gotta smoke this shit so's you can hide  from reality? ... (smokes again) Me I don't need that shit.  I AM reality. Confronting Chris, he moves on, taunting them all.

There's the way it oughta be and there's the way it  is.  'Lias he was full of shit, 'Lias was a crusader  - I got no fight with a man does what he's told but  when he don't, the machine breaks down, and when the  machine breaks down, WE break down ... and I ain't  gonna allow that.  From none of you.  Not one ... Walks past Rhah, past King, throws the pot bowl into the the floor.

Y'all loved Elias, want to kick ass, I'se here - all  by my lonesome, nobody gonna know.  Five you boys  'gainst me? (pause, very soft) Kill me. Almost an appeal - naked, intense.  Rhah, Francis, Doc lo King, the biggest one there, is about to say something, b moment passes. Chris waits, his anger on the rise. Barnes takes a swigger from the whiskey, then turns away  contemptuously.
I SHIT on all o' you.
Chris slams into Barnes, rushing him off his feet.  Pound face, solid blows.

Get that mother, babe, go ... Kick his ass, kill that  cocksucker!!! But Barnes is too quick and very strong and takes the blo getting outside Chris' arm, twisting and flipping him in wrestler's grip - throwing him hard onto his back on the floor. The expression of the Men watching slumps, their hopes da Barnes springs around on Chris, straddles him, one hand p his face back, hits him hard.  Once.  Twice. Chris grimaces, groans, helpless now.  A flick of sound. A knife whipped out of Barnes' boot and pressing against throat.  Chris bleeding from the nose and mouth. Rhah suddenly spinning into action, fast now, realizing w Barnes intends to do.
Barnes is on the verge - about to kill again. Chris waiting. Rhah coaxing him, moving closer.

You'll do dinky dau in Long Binh Barnes.  Ten years -  kill an enlisted.  Ten years, Barnes, just climb the  walls.  DON'T DO IT ... Barnes' eyes tremble in the candle light, his scars ugly, clenching and locking his facial muscles.  Then suddenly calm again, very calm.  We sense a man of enormous self-c Suddenly he flicks his knife across Chris, leaving a mark his left eye. Chris gasps.  Looking up at Barnes rising off him.  The b alongside his face. The Men looking on, the tension lowering.
(contemptuous) Death?  What do you guys know about it? He walks out.  Quietly.

Chris sits at the very edge of a Huey Chopper, bandana ar forehead, long hair blowing in the wind, Barnes' mark bel eyes, slicked out now like a jungle veteran, looking down VILLAGE where the massacre occurred. The Village is still a smoking ruin, a few peasants and w buffalo straggling like ants to reconstruct. Bunny, next to Chris, pops his gum, indifferent.  Barnes, him, shifts, reads a map. Rodriguez is praying, his mouth moving without audible wo getting ready for the drop. King is making last minute adjustments in his pack. Bunny now nudges Chris, points.  The Church in the Jungle Elias was killed is visible.  An outline of the Cemetery. Uncomfortable memories play over Chris' face.

They sent us back into the valley the next day -  about 2,000 metres from Cambodia - into a battalion  perimeter.  Alpha Company had been hit hard the day  before by a sizeable force and Charlie Company had  been probed that night.  There were other battalions  in the valley, we weren't the only ones but we knew  we were going to be the bait to lure them out.  And  somewhere out there was the entire 141st NVA  Regiment. The BATTALION PERIMETER now breaks in the clear ahead.  S grenades of various colors are being popped on the cleare It's not big, its radius 200 yards, heavily sandbagged, d dug, rolls of barbed wire protecting it, radio antennas s from the CP - and surrounded on all four sides by jungle. The First Chopper rocking down, whipping up dust clouds. jumps out, moving out fast as the Second Chopper starts i

At the Battalion CP, the Major confers with Captain Harri two other Captains.  Two NVA PRISONERS are sitting on the knees, interrogated by Vietnamese Kit Carson scouts and a Sergeant, their hands tied. The Scout slaps the shit out of the NVA.
All this is watched from a distance by Ace and Doc and Lt at the Platoon CP.  Ace and Doc are digging the foxhole, of spades in Ace's helmet band, sharing the information w and Francis.

... they caught 'em last night pulling some shit on  Charlie Company.  They found maps on 'em, man - got a  friend at Battalion says they had every fuckin'  foxhole here fixed on it.  Distances, treelines, our  claymores, trip wires, everything?  I shit you not.
Shit, so what the fuck are we doing here?  Why don't  we move ... (no answer) Bad vibes, man, I got bad vibes here.  Where are the  new guys they provided us anyway.
I heard we's in Cambodia right fuckin' NOW.
You kidding man ... Rhah comes up, a walking stick in hand, huge pirate kerch his head, semi-naked.
You wanted to see me sir?
Jackson, looks like you got Elias' squad now.
Squad?  I didn't know we was still referring to this  platoon in terms of squads sir. (with a snicker for Ace and Doc)
(indicating a rough drawing in the dirt) These two holes are yours ...
Begging your pardon Lieutenant but my holes are far  enuff apart you could run a regiment through there  and nobody'd see them - I got five live bodies left  ...
I don't want to hear your problems, Jackson.  You'll  get new men any day.  Time being you make do like  everybody else.
Hey Lieutenant I didn't ask for this job, I ...
(leaves) I don't want to hear about it Jackson.
(amazed, looking off at him) You don't want to hear about it?
(turns) That's right.  I don't want to hear about it 'cause  to tell you the truth, I don't give a shit okay ... I  just don't give a shit anymore.
(shrugs, to himself) Right ...
(passing Ace digging the CP hole) This is one time we could sure use Elias.
(to Doc) 'Some people say I'm wishy washy.  Maybe I am.  Maybe  I ain't.'

On the edge of the perimeter, King puts out his claymore, unraveling it back towards his FOXHOLE, intersecting MEN Third Platoon, who file out on a night ambush, skirting t wires, demoralized, silent.  Eye exchanges, but no words. Chris sits on the foxhole watching the ambush go out, smo joint by himself, depressed.  King comes in with the clay wires, attaching them to their detonators.  Their foxhole are all of the Platoon's - is positioned just inside the bordering the LZ, so that they are quite isolated from th of the perimeter where they first landed.

Glad I ain't going with 'em.  Somewhere out dere man  is de Beast and he hungry tonight ... Man, what a  bummer.  Ten days and a wakeup and I'm still dealing  wid this shit - fuckin' etcetera and ad infinitum man  ... The LAST SOLDIER in the file recedes into the foliage.

(noticiing Chris' silence) What's the matter wid you? ... How come you ain't  writing no more?  You was always writing something  home.  Looks like youse half a bubble off, Taylor. He doesn't answer, makes a futile gesture.
What about your folks?  That grandma you was telling  me about? ... Chris shakes his head.
Girl? Chris' eyes answer negatively.
Must be somebody?
... there's nobody.
(shifts, uncomfortable) You been smoking too much shit babe.  Gotta control  that.  Takes a man down ... I remember when you first  come out to the bush, you was straight as a ...
Who gives a shit! He shifts, annoyed, prepares his grenades along the sand King shrugs, preparing his meal, sings himself a snatch o a good natured man.
(soft) 'People say I'm the life of the party cause I tell a  joke or two although I may be laughing loud and hardy  deep inside I'm blue ...'
Y'ever get caught in a mistake King and you just  can't get out of it?
Way out of anything, man.  Just keep your pecker up,  your powder dry, the worm WILL turn.  How many days  you short?

Not just me ... it's the way the whole thing works.   People like Elias get wasted and people like Barnes  just go on making up rules any way they want and what  do we do, we just sit around in the middle and suck  on it!  We just don't add up to dry shit.

Does a chicken have lips?  Whoever said we did, babe.   Make it outta here, it's all gravy, every day of the  rest of your life man - gravy.  Oh shit, superlifer! O'Neill comes up, jerks his thumb at King.
Get your gear together, King, your orders just come  through.

FADE BACK IN.  Vague sunlight.  Blurry. Chris fluttering eyes.  A sharp MOVEMENT in the bush.  His eyes fight thei open. SOFT EYES are watching him from behind foliage.  A soft, head, alert, rigidly still. Chris fights his way up to his elbow, in pain, looking at eyes.  The head turns and in one fluid move, bolts.  Gone the wind.  A deer.  A big brown deer.  Or was it?  Chris never be quite sure.  But whatever it was, it was surely of grace - the grace of Elias.  This he knows as he feels for the first time alive. And in pain.  His left hand torn and bleeding, shrapnel i side, cuts on his face, dried blood caking him.  Looking his garden of eden.  A messy jungle floor.  Cordite fumes Burned bush and trees.  Torn sandbags. Past scores of NVA bodies.  Past the Foxhole where Bunny dead in the bottom, faceless.  Looking over at Junior bay to the ground, dead. Just cold satisfaction and little feeling le Behind him, the SOUND of a big machine moving.  He turns. Behind SECOND MONSTER MAN and the ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER grin engine, a human skull hanging from its turret.

Passing: Groups of SOLDIERS looking like bowery bums and moving li through the smoke and garbage snooping for souvenirs with tired eyes and grunts of greed. (into radio, exhausted) - 37 U.S. KIA, 122 wounded and still counting.   Estimate 500 Victor Charlie KIA, 22 wounded and still  counting.  Over.
